title: Stream and Scream: 20 horror flicks available on Netflix including 'Saw,' 'Children of the Corn' and more
text:
Stream and Scream: 20 horror flicks available on Netflix this October Amber Sutton | asutton@al.com "Do you like scary movies?" 
Good, because October is finally here. Now's the perfect time to get into the Halloween mood and settle in for a night of horror and gore with these 20 films available on Netflix this month. Everett Collection(SCREAM_Scream The Omen (1976) 
In the original film adaption of "The Omen," a loving couple, played by Gregory Peck and Lee Remick, unknowingly become parents to everyone's favorite anti-christ. Picasa The Devil's Rejects (2005) 
Directed by Rob Zombie, "The Devil's Rejects" tells of a lethal family as they embark on a gruesome and gory murder spree while alluding police and adding to their body count. (c)Lions Gate/Courtesy Everett Co The Babadook (2014) 
This psychological thriller follows a woman and her son, who is afraid of the evil creature living in their house. While the mother assumes the monster tormenting her son is imaginary, she quickly learns that isn't the case. (c)IFC Films/Courtesy Everett Col Oculus (2013) 
In "Oculus," A woman, played by Karen Gillan, suspects that an antique mirror is plaguing her family with untimely deaths and supernatural occurences. And guess what? She's right. Courtesy Everett Collection Night of the Living Dead (1968) 
In this classic George A. Romero horror flick, a group of townspeople fight to stay alive when zombies hungry for flesh invade the farmhouse they're all trapped inside. Courtesy Everett Collection Sleepy Hollow (1999) 
Directed by Tim Burton and starring Johnny Depp, "Sleepy Hollow" taps into Washington Irving's "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow," which centers around the less than courageous Ichabod Crane and a mysterious headless horseman. (c)Paramount/Courtesy Everett Col Scream (1996) 
Directed by Wes Craven, "Scream" follows a group of friends as they're stalked by a serial killer with an horror movie obsession. The film stars Drew Barrymore, Neve Campbell, Courtney Cox and more. Bonus flicks: "Scream 2" and "Scream 3" are also streaming on Netflix. (c)Dimension Films/Courtesy Evere Saw (2004) 
In "Saw," a lunatic forces strangers to choose whether they value their own lives above the lives of others by putting them in twisted and gruesome situations where killing is the only way out. Bonus flicks: The entire "Saw" franchise is streaming on Netflix. (c)Lions Gate/Courtesy Everett Co Insidious: Chapter 2 (2013) 
The Lambert family thought their nightmare was over after the happenings of "Insidious," but the horrors continue to haunt them as they struggle to survive a terrifying history of secrets in "Insidious: Chapter 2." FilmDistrict/courtesy Everett Co Devil (2010) 
Combine the ultimate demon with the claustrophobic setting that is an elevator and you’ve got yourself the premise of “Devil.” The film centers around a group of strangers trapped in an elevator with, you guessed it, Satan himself. (c)Universal/Courtesy Everett Col Children of the Corn (1984) 
Stephen King's "Children of the Corn," which stars Linda Hamilition and Peter Horton, focuses on a remote town where its child inhabitants believe anyone over the age of 18 must be killed. (c)New World Releasing/Courtesy E The Blair Witch Project (1999) 
"The Blair Witch Project" is a "documentary" based on the left behind footage of three film students that set out to find out the truth about the witch that many believe haunts the local woods. (c)Artisan Entertainment/Courtesy Sorority Row (2009) 
A house of sorority sisters are slowly being killed off after the girls cover up the death of one of their own. Is the serial killer supernatural or someone of this earth out for revenge? Summit Entertainment/Courtesy Ev American Psycho (2000) 
"American Psychos" tells of a wealthy banker, played by Christian Bale, with an alter-ego that enjoys brutually murdering those around him. Bonus flick: "American Psycho II: All-American Girl" is also streaming on Netflix. (c)Lions Gate/Courtesy Everett Co Woman in Black 2: Angel of Death (2014) 
Set 40 years after "The Woman in Black," a group of children evacuated from World War II are haunted by a sinister being occupying their new home. Courtesy Everett Collection Hellraiser (1987) 
Clive Barker's "Hellraiser" is filled with murder, gore, alternate realms and deadly puzzles that cause mayhem inside a house occupied by a family full of secrets. (c)New World Releasing/Courtesy E Halloween: Resurrection (2002) 
Michael Myers is back, and out to prove he's still got it in this continuation of the classic "Halloween" franchise, which stars Jamie Lee Curtis, Busta Rhymes, Tyra Banks and more. (c)Miramax/Courtesy Everett Colle Would You Rather (2012) 
A young woman, played by Brittany Snow, finds herself unintentionally invovled in a deadly round of "Would You Rather," but stays in the game in hopes of helping her sick brother. (c)IFC Films/Courtesy Everett Col Leprechaun (1993) 
Who knew St. Patrick's Day had a bit of horror under its sleeve? In this cult classic, Jennifer Anniston and company are stalked by a sinister leprechaun unwilling to part ways with his lucky pot of gold. (c)Trimark Pictures/Courtesy Ever Nightbreed (1990) 
In this fantasty horror turned cult classic, a teenager with mental illness inhabits a cemetery alongside a variety of monsters and ghouls. "Nightbreed" stars Craig Sheffer and was directed by Clive Barker. (c)20thCentFox/Courtesy Everett C
